p: The genus Curcuma as one of the most important genera of the Zingiberaceae family comprises about 93â€“110 species with multiple uses as traditional medicine as well as in the modern industries [ 6, 7]. The bioactive constituents in a rhizome of Curcuma species are related mostly to the non-volatile curcuminoids (curcumin, demethoxycurcumin, bisdemethoxycurcumin) and the volatile oil rich in sesquiterpenoids and monoterpenoids [ 6, 8]. The phytochemical constituents of about 31 Curcuma species have been studied up to date [ 9], among which C. longa (turmeric) and C. zedoaria (zedoary) are the most well studied and reported [ 6, 10].
